alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 2:53PM EST until February 25 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Black Creek At Churchville affecting Monroe and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Rapids affecting Erie and Niagara Counties. .Rain and snowmelt led to rising levels on creeks and rivers. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Black Creek...including Churchville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Churchville. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flood stage, more widespread agricultural land flooding, some backyard and basement flooding Churchville to Chili but minimal damages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 6.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 05/07/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
